      • authenticateClient

        public static boolean authenticateClient(String clientId,
                                         String clientSecretProvided)
                                  throws IdentityOAuthAdminException,
                                         IdentityOAuth2Exception,
                                         org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth.common.exception.InvalidOAuthClientException
        Authenticate the OAuth Consumer
        Parameters:
        clientId - Consumer Key/Id
        clientSecretProvided - Consumer Secret issued during the time of registration
        Returns:
        true, if the authentication is successful, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuthAdminException - Error when looking up the credentials from the database
        IdentityOAuth2Exception
        org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth.common.exception.InvalidOAuthClientException

        Returns:

      • getAuthenticatedUsername

        public static String getAuthenticatedUsername(String clientId,
                                              String clientSecretProvided)
                                       throws IdentityOAuthAdminException,
                                              IdentityOAuth2Exception,
                                              org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth.common.exception.InvalidOAuthClientException
        Deprecated. Authenticate the OAuth consumer and return the username of user which own the provided client id and client secret.
        Parameters:
        clientId - Consumer Key/Id
        clientSecretProvided - Consumer Secret issued during the time of registration
        Returns:
        Username of the user which own client id and client secret if authentication is successful. Empty string otherwise.
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuthAdminException - Error when looking up the credentials from the database
        IdentityOAuth2Exception
        org.wso2.carbon.identity.oauth.common.exception.InvalidOAuthClientException

        authzCode - Authorization Code issued to the client
        Returns:

      • buildCacheKeyStringForToken

        public static String buildCacheKeyStringForToken(String clientId,
                                                 String scope,
                                                 String authorizedUser,
                                                 String authenticatedIDP)
        Build the cache key string when storing token info in cache.
        Parameters:
        clientId - ClientId of the App.
        scope - Scopes used.
        authorizedUser - Authorised user.
        authenticatedIDP - Authenticated IdP.
        Returns:
        Cache key string combining the input parameters.

        public static String getMappedUserStoreDomain(String userStoreDomain)
                                       throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the mapped user store if a mapping is defined for this user store in AccessTokenPartitioningDomains element in identity.xml, or the original userstore domain if the mapping is not available.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:

      • getPartitionedTableByUserStore

        public static String getPartitionedTableByUserStore(String tableName,
                                                    String userStoreDomain)
                                             throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the updated table name using user store domain if a mapping is defined for this users store in AccessTokenPartitioningDomains element in identity.xml, or the original table name if the mapping is not available.

        Updated table name derived by appending a underscore and mapped user store domain name to the origin table name.

        Parameters:
        userStoreDomain -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserStore

        public static String getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserStore(String sql,
                                                       String userStoreDomain)
                                                throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the updated sql using user store domain if access token partitioning enabled & username assertion enabled or the original sql otherwise.

        Updated sql derived by replacing original table names IDN_OAUTH2_ACCESS_TOKEN & IDN_OAUTH2_ACCESS_TOKEN_SCOPE with the updated table names which derived using getPartitionedTableByUserStore() method.

        Parameters:
        sql -
        userStoreDomain -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserId

        public static String getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserId(String sql,
                                                    String username)
                                             throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the updated sql using username.

        If the username contains the domain separator, updated sql derived using getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserStore() method. Returns the original sql otherwise.

        Parameters:
        sql -
        username -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • getTokenPartitionedSqlByToken

        public static String getTokenPartitionedSqlByToken(String sql,
                                                   String token)
                                            throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        Returns the updated sql using token.

        If the token contains the username appended, updated sql derived using getTokenPartitionedSqlByUserId() method. Returns the original sql otherwise.

        Parameters:
        sql -
        token -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception

      • getFederatedIdPFromDomain

        public static String getFederatedIdPFromDomain(String userStoreDomain)

        userStoreDomain - user store domain to be resolved from
        Returns:
        federated IdP name if user store domain is of format FEDERATED:{federated-idp-name}. Else returns null.

      • addTokenDOtoCache

        public static void addTokenDOtoCache(AccessTokenDO newTokenBean)
                              throws IdentityOAuth2Exception
        There are cases where we store an 'alias' of the token returned to the client as the token inside IS. For example, in the case of JWT access tokens we store the 'jti' claim in the database instead of the actual JWT. Therefore we need to cache an AccessTokenDO with the stored token identifier.
        Parameters:
        newTokenBean - token DO to be added to the cache.
        Throws:
        IdentityOAuth2Exception
